message: A press release that Stein issued emphasized some of the reasons why the attorney general thinks human trafficking is an urgent issue. It noted that North Carolina has one of the 10 highest reported rates of human trafficking in the country, but that the crime goes under-reported because it goes unrecognized for what it is or because victims don’t believe anyone will help them.

data.description: Legislature approved funds to deploy signs in fight against human trafficking in last year's appropriations bill. Attorney General warns that crimes often go unrecognized.
data.title: State to post signs in effort to combat human-trafficking crimes
